bitfield.description: USBOTGSS_WRAPPER Revision

register.description: Controls various parameters of the master and slave interfaces.

bitfield.description: Software reset for the USBOTGSS_WRAPPER register set. Self-clearing. Does not affect the core register set.
Disable/Enable control of the DMA master (initiator) to block read/write accesses. Bit is auto-cleared (to 0) by HW in case of outgoing access, but must be set (to 1) manually.

bitenum.description: Enable the DMA. The enabling can also be done by the hardware, i.e. bit it auto-cleared.
Disable the DMA. software must ensure that there are no ongoing transactions before setting this bit. The disabling can only be done by software.
DMA is disabled, outgoing read/write accesses are blocked. When in smart-standby mode, standby is requested.
DMA is enabled, outgoing read/write accesses are possible. When in smart-standby mode, standby exit is requested.

bitfield.description: PM mode of local initiator (master). Initiator may generate read/write transaction as long as it is out of STANDBY state.

bitenum.description: Force-standby: initiator is unconditionally placed in standby state.
No-standby: initiator is unconditionally placed out of standby state.
Smart-Standby, wakeup-capable: initiator's standby state depends on internal conditions, i.e. the module's functional requirements. Asynchronous wakeup events can be generated.
Smart-standby: initiator's standby state depends on internal conditions, i.e. the module's functional requirements. Asynchronous wakeup events cannot be generated.

bitfield.description: PM mode of local target (slave). Target shall be capable of handling read/write transaction as long as it is out of IDLE state.

bitenum.description: Force-idle mode: local target's idle state follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests unconditionally, regardless of the IP module's internal requirements.
No-idle mode: local target never enters idle state.

Smart-idle wakeup-capable mode: local target's idle state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements. IP module may generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events when in idle state.

Smart-idle mode: local target's idle state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements. Module shall not generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events.

register.description: Raw status of main core interrupt request. Set even if event is not enabled. Write 1 to set, used mostly for debug (regular status also gets set if enabled).

bitfield.description: IRQ status for core: see status registerUSBOTGSS_IMAN[0] IP

register.description: 'regular' status of main core interrupt request. Set only when enabled, self-cleared unless it was set by writing to, for debug. Write 1 to clear (raw status also gets cleared).

bitfield.description: IRQ status for core: see status registerUSBOTGSS_IMAN[0] IP

register.description: Enable of main core interrupt request. Write 1 to set (i.e. to enable interrupt). Readout is the same as corresponding _CLR register.

bitfield.description: IRQ enable for main core interrupt

register.description: Enable of main core interrupt request. Write 1 to clear (i.e. to disable interrupt). Readout is the same as corresponding _SET register.

bitfield.description: IRQ enable for main core interrupt

register.description: Raw status of secondary interrupt requests. Set even if event is not enabled. Write 1 to set the (raw) status, mostly for debug (regular status also gets set).

bitfield.description: DMA-disable self-clear IRQ status:USBOTGSS_SYSCONFIG[17] DMADISABLE hardware-cleared (to 0) because of DMA access. Not triggered by a software clear.
OTG event in core, IRQ status: see status registerUSBOTGSS_OEVT
Drive VBUS control rise IRQ status
Charge VBUS control rise IRQ status
Discharge VBUS control rise IRQ status
ID pullup control rise IRQ status
Drive VBUS control fall IRQ status
Charge VBUS control fall IRQ status
Discharge VBUS control fall IRQ status
ID pullup control fall IRQ status

register.description: Regular status of secondary interrupt requests. Set only when enabled. Write 1 to clear after interrupt is serviced (raw status also gets cleared).

bitfield.description: DMA-disable self-clear IRQ status:USBOTGSS_SYSCONFIG[17] DMADISABLE hardware-cleared (to 0) because of DMA access. Not triggered by a software clear.
OTG event in core, IRQ status: see status registerUSBOTGSS_OEVT.
Drive VBUS control rise IRQ status
Charge VBUS control rise IRQ status
Discharge VBUS control rise IRQ status
ID pullup control rise IRQ status
Drive VBUS control fall IRQ status
Charge VBUS control fall IRQ status
Discharge VBUS control fall IRQ status
ID pullup control fall IRQ status

register.description: Enable secondary interrupt requests. Write 1 to set (that is, to enable interrupt). Readout is the same as corresponding _CLR register.

bitfield.description: DMA-disable self-clear, IRQ enable
OTG event in core, IRQ enable
Drive VBUS control rise IRQ enable
Charge VBUS control rise IRQ enable
Discharge VBUS control rise IRQ enable
ID pullup control rise IRQ enable
Drive VBUS control fall IRQ enable
Charge VBUS control fall IRQ enable
Discharge VBUS control fall IRQ enable
ID pullup control fall IRQ enable

register.description: Enable secondary interrupt requests. Write 1 to clear (that is, to disable interrupt). Readout is the same as corresponding _SET register.

bitfield.description: DMA-disable self-clear, IRQ enable
OTG event in core, IRQ enable
Drive VBUS control rise IRQ enable
Charge VBUS control rise IRQ enable
Discharge VBUS control rise IRQ enable
ID pullup control rise IRQ enable
Drive VBUS control fall IRQ enable
Charge VBUS control fall IRQ enable
Discharge VBUS control fall IRQ enable
ID pullup control fall IRQ enable
Drive 5V on VBUS. Plays the role of 'hub_vbus_ctrl' in non-OTG host mode.
Charge VBUS through a resistor for VBUS-pulsing SRP.
Discharge VBUS through a resistor, until the session-end VBUS state is reached.
Pull-up to the (OTG) ID line to allow its sampling
Controls the source of UTMI / PIPE status for VBUS and OTG ID (vbusvalid, sessvalid, sessend, iddig, powerpresent)

bitenum.description: Hardware mode: OTG ID and VBUS status for the USB controller are taken from the UTMI inputs signals
Software mode: OTG ID and VBUS status for the USB controller are taken from the fields of the current register.

bitfield.description: Over-current status, for non-OTG host only.
Software-programmed value of PIPE3.0 PowerPresent (VBUS status) seen by the core, alternative to HW input.
Software-programmed UTMI output txbitstuffenable[h] Note: as per UTMI+, used only in UTMI Opmode 0b11 (i.e. SYNC and EOP generation disabled)
Software-programmed value of UTMI+ IdDig (OTG ID status) seen by the core, alternative to hardware input. Don't care until IdPullup = 1 for at least 50 ms

bitenum.description: ID pin is grounded = OTG A = default Host
ID pin is floating = OTG B = default Peripheral

bitfield.description: Software-programmed value of UTMI+ SessEnd (VBUS status) seen by the core, alternative to HW input.
Software-programmed value of UTMI+ SessValid (VBUS status) seen by the core, alternative to hardware inputs AValid and BValid.
Software-programmed value of UTMI+ VbusValid (VBUS status) seen by the core, alternative to hardware input.

register.description: Offset of Memory-mapped RAM accesses. Page is remapped from 0x8000 to 0xFFFF (32 KiB)

bitfield.description: Byte offset MSBits = page offset

bitenum.description: Page offset for core register set, lower half. DO NOT USE: use static access at offset 0x1_0000+ instead.
Page offset for core register set, upper half. DO NOT USE: use static access at offset 0x1_0000+ instead.
Base page offset for RAM2 (= core byte address 0xC_0000) RAM NOT IMPLEMENTED
Base page offset for RAM1 (= core byte address 0x8_0000): Tx FIFOs. The RAM shall fit inside this page for up to 32 kByte = 8,192 x 64-bit words.
Base page offset for RAM0 (= core byte address 0x4_0000): Rx FIFOs, descriptors, registers. The RAM shall fit inside this page for up to 32 kByte = 8,192 x 64-bit words

bitfield.description: Byte offset LSBits, always 0
Active-high core software reset. Static, i.e. not self-clearing. After clearing, wait for reset completion by polling USBOTGSS_USBSTS[11] CNR bit.
Switches to the legacy xHCI 0.96 host SW API mode. Changes shall take place under core software reset: [31] CORE_SW_RESET = 1.
USB3 port disable, overriding xHCI driver.

bitenum.description: Port stops reporting connect/disconnect events and remains in disabled state.

bitfield.description: USB2 port disable, overriding xHCI driver.

bitenum.description: Port stops reporting connect/disconnect events and remains in disabled state.

bitfield.description: HS Jitter Adjustment, in 30-MHz periods
selection of observed local signals

bitenum.description: Debug output is a selection of UTMI (USB2 PHY) interface signals
Debug output is a selection of PIPE (USB3 PHY) interface signals
Debug output is lower 32 bits controller core's internal trace vector, selected by[21:16] TRACEPORTMUXSEL
Debug output is upper 32 bits controller core's internal trace vector, selected by[21:16] TRACEPORTMUXSEL
Debug output is controller core's internal debug signals

register.description: Data currently visible on DEBUG output (observability) port See [2:0] SEL bit field.

bitfield.description: SEL = 1: utmi_sessend SEL = 2: pipe_rxstatus[2] SEL = 3: core_sm2bl_cur_mode
SEL = 1: utmi_vbusvalid SEL = 2: pipe_rxstatus[1] SEL = 3: core_suspend_n
SEL = 1: utmi_bvalid SEL = 2: pipe_rxstatus[0] SEL = 3: core_suspend_com_n

SEL = 1: utmi_linestate[0] SEL = 2: pipe_txmargin[0] SEL = 3: core_u2mac_txrx_state_0[1]

SEL = 1: utmi_opmode[0] SEL = 2: pipe_txdeemph[0] SEL = 3: core_u2_prt_state[4]

SEL = 1: utmi_xcvrselect[0] SEL = 2: pipe_reset_n SEL = 3: core_u2_prt_state[1]

SEL = 1: utmi_reset SEL = 2: pipe_rxpolarity SEL = 3: core_gsts_buserraddvld
SEL = 1: utmi_rxerror SEL = 2: pipe_txoneszeros SEL = 3: debug_mclk_usof_number[0]
SEL = 1: utmi_rxvalidh SEL = 2: pipe_txelecidle SEL = 3: core_ltdb_link_state[3]
SEL = 1: utmi_rxvalid SEL = 2: pipe_txdetectrxloopback SEL = 3: core_ltdb_link_state[2]

register.description: Enable External Buffer Control (EBC) for selected endpoints. Device mode only.

bitfield.description: Enable EBC HW throttling for OUT EP 15 (USB receive)

bitenum.description: EBC enabled.[15] shall also be set to 1 in DEPCFG command for this EP.

bitfield.description: Enable EBC HW throttling for IN EP 15 (USB transmit)

bitenum.description: EBC enabled.[15] shall also be set to 1 in DEPCFG command for this EP.
